intro: Erythrocephalum albiflorum, commonly known as the whiteflower saltbush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to tolerate saline and nutrient-poor soils. Its leaves are usually small, fleshy, and covered in a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Erythrocephalum albiflorum plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing nectar for native pollinators.
